# Susa known as Royal City
Famous emblem : ğ‡µ Lotus flower / Royal Rosette  

Susa inhabited from as far back as the 8th millenium BC, became important after the 6th.  

Connecting [Vinca](Vinca.html) [Samara](Samara.html) [Sumerian](Sumerian.html) [Ubaid](Ubaid.html) [Eridu](Eridu.html) [Uruk](Uruk.html) [Maykop](Maykop.html) â€¦ and [Mehrgarh](Mehrgarh.html)  

During the [Ubaid](Ubaid.html), Susa was on a corridor spreading **[stamp](stamp.html) [seals](seals.html)** from Anatolia down to [Jiroft](Jiroft.html), before they arrived in Irak! It was an advanced city until the Uruk period when it was lagging behind the new Sumerian force.  

It evolved the Tepe [Gawra](Gawra.html) tradition of depicting the [master of animals](hero) into complex iconographic depictions of rituals:  

![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/pannous/images/main/susa_stamp_seals.jpg)  

Can we see the evolution from shamanic masters of snakes to priestly/kingly masters of bulls and lions to kingly/godly master of humans?  

[Tamer of beasts](hero) motive also on bulae:  

Home of different [Elamite scripts](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Proto-Elamite#Proto-Elamite_script)  

Tomb of prophet [Dan](don)iel in Susa, vision of a **Ram** and Goat (see [Elam](Elam.html) and [Goth](Goth.html)).  
Most famous palace: Apa[Dana](don)  

Susa was conquered and subsequently fortified at the end of the [Ubaid](Ubaid.html). Apadana district surrounded with 7m thick walls between 4200 and 3900 BC.  

Uruk cylinder seals adopted through selective assimilation  

Ceramics industry flourished when in the rest of the Ubaid horizon painted wares became out of fashion and replaced by (war-economy) functional dull pottery. cups, dishes, jars, ğ“¡ goblet with a single handle 3k BC .  

Susa is situated in Khuzestan, one of the hottest parts of Iran, if not the world.  
Rivers EuLaeus[ğ“ƒ¬](ğ“ƒ¬.html), KarKeh=Choaspes[ğ“ƒ—](ğ“ƒ—.html)ğ“†­, Karun and Dez  
EuLaeus also known as Ulai[ğ“ƒ­](ğ“ƒ­.html) and Dez.  

Note the four [river](river.html)s with feline names:  
[ğ“ƒ¬](ğ“ƒ¬.html) Tiger Tigris Hiddekel  
[ğ“ƒ®](ğ“ƒ®.html) LeoPard EuPhrates  
[ğ“ƒ­](ğ“ƒ­.html) Lion EuLaeus  
Missing: 1. Pison Panther? 2. Gihon Karun GePard cheetah? ğ“¼ğ“‚‹ shikaÌ‚r Ø´ÙƒØ§Ø± â‡” Schirkanâ„¢ Cats  

Susa was important center of the Medes empire.

Å imaÅ¡ki (sun) dynasty â‹-2000BC  
Sukkalmah "Grand Regent" vassal dynasty (of Akkadians) â‹-1500BC â‡” Hiksos  
Military clashes with Babylonia (of cause)  

Kidinuid dynasty 1500-1210 BC regainded independence after collapse of Old Babylonian Empire.  

Å utrukid dynasty: Unified kingdom of Elam blossomed  Å utruk-Nahhunte II one of most powerful figures in his time  
Married daugter of Kassite and Babylonian king  
Military campaigns into Babylonia, capturing 700 cities, plundered capital Babylon  
capturing Marduk statue and Hammurabi Code stele and Victory stele (made â‹2222BC)  
Babylonia came under Elamite rule  
Much building: baked brick temple  

Nebuchadnezzar I defeated Elam, starting Dark Age  

The role played by Susa, in southwestern Iran, is an intriguing one in the history of early writing; 184 documents are known from this site, all dated to the Uruk V phase or earlier. The first cylinder sealings on clay bullae are attested in Susa by the Middle Uruk period, far earlier than in Uruk itself.
